Logging Manager#

class server.lib.logging_manager.LoggingManager(enable_logging: bool = False)#

Bases: object

This class handles the logic for logging information to both the console and to log files. It utilizes rotating log files to log server processes and events as well as any errors that may occur.

Parameters

enable_logging (bool, optional) – Enable or disable logging for the current session.

Raises

RuntimeError – If any of the parameters passed through to the constructor is None.

class LogLevel(value)#

Bases: enum.Enum

This enum class defines the types of log levels available for the logging library to use. Do not modify this unless you know what you’re doing!

LOG_CRITICAL = (50, 'critical')#
LOG_DEBUG = (10, 'debug')#
LOG_ERROR = (40, 'error')#
LOG_INFO = (20, 'info')#
LOG_WARNING = (30, 'warning')#
classmethod has_value_id(value: int) → Union[int, str, None]#

This utility method checks if the given enum integer value is present in the Log Level tuple values.

Parameters

value (int) – The integer value to check in the Log Level enum.

Returns

A tuple containing the integer value of the enum and the string representation.

Return type

(int, str) | None

classmethod has_value_label(value: str) → Union[int, str, None]#

This utility method checks if the given enum string value is present in the Log Level tuple values.

Parameters

value (str) – The string value to check in the Log Level enum.

Returns

A tuple containing the integer value of the enum and the string representation.

Return type

(int, str) | None

class Settings#

Bases: object

This class serves as a global store of the application settings which is referenced by multiple other modules such as the logging manager to retrieve runtime parameters.

classmethod get_log_directory() → str#

Retrieves the path of the active logging directory used to store log files.

Returns

The path to the directory containing application log files.

Return type

str

classmethod get_log_level() → server.lib.logging_manager.LoggingManager.LogLevel#

Retrieves the current log level set in the logging manager.

Returns

The active log level being used by the logger.

Return type

LoggingManager.LogLevel

classmethod get_max_log_size() → int#

Retrieves the maximum size (in bytes) that any given log file can be in the application log directory.

Returns

The maximum size (in bytes) of a log file.

Return type

int

classmethod get_max_logs() → int#

Retrieves the maximum logs that can exist at a given time in the application log directory.

Returns

The maximum number of logs that can exist in the application log directory

Return type

int

classmethod set_log_directory(log_directory: str)#

Sets the directory that the active logging system should log files to. If the provided log directory is invalid, no action will be taken.

Parameters

log_directory (str) – The path of the new log directory.

Returns

None

classmethod set_log_level(log_level: server.lib.logging_manager.LoggingManager.LogLevel | str | int)#

Sets the log level of the active logging system. Please refer to the logging_manager.LogLevel enum class to view all the defined log levels.

Parameters

log_level (LoggingManager.LogLevel | str | int) – The log level which should be set in the logging manager. This log level can be passed through as a direct reference of the LogLevel enum or as an integer or string representation.

Returns

None

Raises

RuntimeError – If setting a new logging level was attempted, but the provided log level was invalid.

classmethod set_max_log_size(max_size: int)#

Sets the maximum size (in bytes) that any given log file can be in the application log directory. If a maximum log size of 0 or below is provided, the max size defaults to 65536 bytes.

Parameters

max_size (int) – The maximum size (in bytes) of a log file.

Returns

None

classmethod set_max_logs(max_logs: int)#

Sets the maximum number of logs that can exist at a given time in the application log directory. If the maximum number of logs is exceeded, new logs will replace the oldest log in the directory.

Parameters

max_logs (int) – The maximum number of logs that can exist at a given time.

Returns

None

classmethod disable()#

Disables logging in the logging manager if the instance is initialized. Disabling logging will prevent messages and events from being logged in the application log files or displayed in the console.

Returns

None

classmethod enable()#

Enables logging in the logging manager if the instance is initialized.

Returns

None

classmethod get_logger() → logging.Logger | None#

Retrieves the logger from the current active logging manager instance.

Returns

The logger from the current instance, or None if it has not been initialized.

Return type

logging.Logger | None

classmethod initialize_logging()#

Initializes the logger library with a rotating file handler and the parameters provided. Make sure the logging manager is initialized before initializing logging.

Returns

None

Raises

RuntimeError – If the logging manager has not been initialized.

classmethod instance()#

Retrieves an instance of the current logging manager instance or raises an error if the manager has not been initialized yet.

Returns

The instance of the logging manager.

Return type

LoggingManager

classmethod is_enabled() → bool | None#

Checks if logging is enabled or disabled in the logging manager.

Returns

True if logging is enabled, False if logging is disabled, or None if the instance is not initialized.

Return type

bool | None

classmethod log(log_type: server.lib.logging_manager.LoggingManager.LogLevel, message: Union[List[str], str], origin: Optional[str] = None, error_type: Optional[str] = None, no_print: bool = True, exc_message: Optional[str] = None)#

The primary method used to log messages to the application log files and to the console output. Utilize this method instead of print() or any other built-in method to display messages in the console.

Parameters

  • log_type (LoggingManager.LogLevel, required) – The log level of the logger (debug, info, warning, error, critical)

  • message (Union[List[str], str], required) – The message that must be logged or printed by the application.

  • origin (str, optional) – The origin of the event that needs to be logged. Please refer to the strings module for a list of defined log origins.

  • error_type (str, optional) – If logging an error, the type of error that is being logged. Please refer to the error_codes module for a list of defined error types.

  • no_print (bool, optional) – Set to false if the message being logged should also be printed to the console.

  • exc_message (str, optional) – If logging an error, the exception stack trace should be passed here as a string.

Returns

None
